page.title: 11FARMING - GENERAL
page.content: FARMING-GENERAL Nearly all farms are tenant occupied and form part of the Horsebrook Estate. The sizes of the farms vary from 100-300 acres.The type of farming is usually arable but there is also livestock farming.Arable farms grow wheat,potatoes,spring-barley, grass and winter-barley. The livestock on the farms are mostly dairy cows,dairy followers, beef cattle and sheep.The produce of the farms is milk which goes to the milk marketing board,cattle which go to markets in the area and grain sales to those from whom the farmers can obtain the highest price.
